en: If you’re reading this because you think you might be one, my advice is: close this book right now. Believe whatever lie your mom or dad told you about your birth, and try to lead a normal life.
vi: Nếu khi đọc sách này, bạn cho rằng một nửa dòng máu chảy trong huyết quản mình thuộc về thần thánh, tôi khuyên bạn hãy đóng sách lại ngay đi. Hãy tin mọi lời dối trá về thân thế của mình từ cha mẹ và sống cuộc đời bình dị như bao người khác.
tr: Siz de melez olduğunuzu düşünerek bu satırları okuyorsanız, tavsiyem şu: kitabı hemen kapatın! Anne babanız nasıl doğduğunuza dair hangi yalanı söylediyse ona inanın ve normal bir yaşam sürmeyi deneyin.
es: Si estás leyendo esto porque crees que podrías estar en la misma situación, mi consejo es éste: cierra el libro inmediatamente. Créete la mentira que tu padre o tu madre te contaran sobre tu nacimiento, e intenta llevar una vida normal.
vi_translation: If when reading this book, you believe that half the blood flowing in your veins belongs to the divine, I advise you to close the book immediately. Believe all the lies about your origins from your parents and live a simple life like everyone else.
tr_translation: If you are reading these lines thinking that you are a hybrid, my advice is this: close the book immediately! Believe whatever lie your parents told you about how you were born and try to lead a normal life.
es_translation: If you are reading this because you think you might be in the same situation, my advice is this: close the book immediately. Believe the lie that your father or mother told you about your birth, and try to lead a normal life.

en: But if you recognize yourself in these pages-if you feel something stirring inside-stop reading immediately. You might be one of us. And once you know that, it’s only a matter of time before they sense it too, and they’ll come for you.
vi: Nếu thấy những gì tả trong sách này giống với mình quá, nếu thấy trực giác, linh tính không chịu ngủ yên, hãy ngừng đọc ngay vì có thể bạn giống chúng tôi. Nếu bạn biết, chẳng chóng thì chày chúng cũng đánh hơi thấy và tìm đến lấy mạng bạn.
tr: Ama eğer bu sayfalarda kendinizi buluyorsanız, içinizde bir şeyler kıpır kıpır oluyorsa, hemen okumayı bırakın. Siz de bizlerden biri olabilirsiniz. Bir kere bunu anladınız mı, onların da bunu hissetmesi an meselesi olacak ve peşinize düşecekler.
es: Pero si te reconoces en estas páginas —si sientes que algo se remueve en tu interior—, deja de leer al instante. Podrías ser uno de nosotros. Y en cuanto lo sepas, sólo es cuestión de tiempo que también ellos lo presientan, y entonces irán por ti.
vi_translation: If you find that what is described in this book is too similar to yourself, if you feel that your intuition and instincts won't stay quiet, stop reading immediately because you might be like us. If you know, sooner or later they will sniff it out and come to take your life.
tr_translation: But if you find yourself in these pages, if something inside you starts to stir, stop reading immediately. You might be one of us. Once you understand this, it will only be a matter of time before they sense it too and come after you.
es_translation: But if you recognize yourself in these pages —if you feel something stirring inside you— stop reading immediately. You could be one of us. And as soon as you know it, it's only a matter of time before they sense it too, and then they will come for you.

en: I’m twelve years old. Until a few months ago, I was a boarding student at Yancy Academy, a private school for troubled kids in upstate New York.
vi: Tôi mười hai tuổi. Vài tháng trước đây, tôi còn là học sinh nội trú tại Học việc Yancy, một trường tư dành cho học sinh cá biệt thuộc khu vực thượng New York.
tr: On iki yaşındayım. Birkaç ay öncesine kadar, New York'un dışındaki, sorunlu çocuklar için özel bir okul olan Yancy Akademisi'nde yaülı öğrenciydim.
es: Tengo doce años. Hasta hace unos meses estudiaba interno en la academia Yancy, un colegio privado para niños con problemas, en el norte del estado de Nueva York.
vi_translation: I am twelve years old. A few months ago, I was still a boarding student at Yancy Academy, a private school for troubled students in upstate New York.
tr_translation: I am twelve years old. Until a few months ago, I was a boarding student at Yancy Academy, a private school for troubled children outside of New York.
es_translation: I am twelve years old. Until a few months ago, I was a boarding student at Yancy Academy, a private school for troubled kids in upstate New York.

en: I looked at the carving, and felt a flush of relief, because I actually recognized it. “That’s Kronos eating his kids, right?”
vi: Nhìn bức điêu khắc, tôi mừng rơn vì biết khá rõ: - Có phải Kronos đang nuốt các con vào bụng không ạ?
tr: Oymaya baktım ve içime bir rahatlık doldu, ne olduğunu gerçekten hatırlamıştım. "Bu Kronos, kendi çocuklarını yiyor, değil mi?
es: Miré el relieve y sentí alivio porque de hecho lo reconocía. —Ése es Cronos devorando a sus hijos, ¿no?
vi_translation: Looking at the sculpture, I was overjoyed because I knew it quite well: - Is Kronos swallowing his children?
tr_translation: I looked at the carving and felt a sense of relief inside me; I had truly remembered what it was. "This is Kronos, eating his own children, right?"
es_translation: I looked at the relief and felt relieved because I actually recognized it. —That is Cronos devouring his children, isn't it?

en: I tried to stay cool. The school counselor had told me a million times, “Count to ten, get control of your temper.” But I was so mad my mind went blank. A wave roared in my ears.
vi: Tôi cố không nổi nóng. Nhân viên tư vấn tâm lý của trường dặn tôi cả triệu lần rằng: “Nếu gặp chuyện chướng tai gai mắt, hãy đếm đến mười và cố tự chủ”. Nhưng lúc này tôi giận quá nên không nhớ được gì. Hai tai tôi lùng bùng như có ai đánh trống trận bên trong.
tr: Sakin olmaya çalıştım. Okul danışmanım bana bir milyon kez söylemişti, "Ona kadar say, öfkeni denetlemeye çalış. "Ama öylesine delirmiştim ki, aklımdaki her şey uçup gitmişti. Kulaklarım uğuldamaya başlamıştı.
es: Intenté mantener la calma. El consejero de la escuela me había dicho un millón de veces: «Cuenta hasta diez, controla tu mal genio.» Pero yo estaba tan cabreado que me quedé en blanco. Y a continuación oí un revuelo y estrépito de agua.
vi_translation: I tried not to get angry. The school counselor had told me a million times: "If you encounter something upsetting, count to ten and try to stay calm." But right now, I'm so angry that I can't remember anything. My ears are ringing as if someone is beating a drum inside them.
tr_translation: I tried to stay calm. My school counselor had told me a million times, "Count to ten, try to control your anger. " But I was so furious that everything in my mind had vanished. My ears had started to buzz.
es_translation: I tried to stay calm. The school counselor had told me a million times: "Count to ten, control your temper." But I was so angry that I went blank. And then I heard a commotion and the splash of water.

en: I have moments like that a lot, when my brain falls asleep or something, and the next thing I know I’ve missed something, as if a puzzle piece fell out of the universe and left me staring at the blank place behind it. The school counselor told me this was part of the ADHD, my brain misinterpreting things.
vi: Chuyện ấy thường hay xảy đến với tôi. Chắc thi thoảng não tôi lại ngủ quên. Ngay sau đó, tôi biết mình vừa bỏ lỡ một điều gì đó, như thể một mảnh ghép của trò chơi xếp hình vừa tan vào hư không, để mặc tôi đứng đó nhìn trân vào chỗ trống. Nhân viên tư vấn tâm lý của trường bảo đó một phần là do chứng mất tập trung do hiếu động thái quá: não tôi nhận thức sai về sự vật hiện tượng bên ngoài.
tr: Başıma böyle şeyler çok gelir. Beynim bazen uyuyakalıyormuş gibi, bir bakmışım bir şeyi gözden kaçırmışım, sanki evren denen bulmacanın bir parçası düşmüş de kalan boşluğa bakıyormuşum gibi. Okul danışmanım bunun DEHB'den, yani bendeki Dikkat Eksikliği Hiperaktivite Bozukluğu'ndan kaynaklandığını söylemişti; beynim bazı şeyleri yanlış yorumluyormuş.
es: Suelo tener momentos como ése, cuando mi cerebro parece quedarse dormido, y lo siguiente que ocurre es que me he perdido algo, como si una pieza de puzzle se hubiera caído del universo y me dejara mirando el vacío detrás. El consejero del colegio me dijo que era una consecuencia del THDA, Trastorno Hiperactivo del Déficit de Atención: mi cerebro malinterpretando las cosas.
vi_translation: That often happens to me. Sometimes my brain just falls asleep. Right after that, I realize I've just missed something, as if a piece of a jigsaw puzzle has vanished into thin air, leaving me staring at the empty space. The school counselor said it's partly due to attention deficit hyperactivity disorder: my brain misinterprets external phenomena.
tr_translation: Such things happen to me a lot. It's like my brain sometimes falls asleep, and before I know it, I've missed something, as if a piece of the puzzle called the universe has fallen out and I'm staring at the empty space left behind. My school counselor said it was due to ADHD, that is, Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder that I have; my brain misinterprets some things.
es_translation: I tend to have moments like that, when my brain seems to fall asleep, and the next thing that happens is that I've missed something, as if a piece of the puzzle had fallen out of the universe and left me staring at the void behind. The school counselor told me it was a consequence of ADHD, Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder: my brain misinterpreting things.

en: A shadow slid across the lighted glass of Brunner’s office door, the shadow of something much taller than my wheelchair-bound teacher, holding something that looked suspiciously like an archer’s bow.
vi: Một bóng đen vụt qua khung cửa kinh sáng đèn trước phòng thầy Brunner. Cái bóng cao lớn hơn ông thầy cả đời ngồi xe lăn rất nhiều, nắm lăm lăm trong tay một thứ rất giống cây cung.
tr: Brunner'ın odasının kapısındaki pencereden çıkan ışığın önünden bir gölge geçti. Bu gölge benim tekerlekli sandalyede oturan öğretmenimden çok, hem de çok uzun bir şeyin gölgesiydi; elinde de bir okçunun yayına benzer, tuhaf bir şey tutuyordu.
es: Una sombra cruzó el cristal iluminado de la puerta del despacho, la sombra de algo mucho más alto que Brunner en su silla de ruedas, con algo en la mano que se parecía sospechosamente a un arco.
vi_translation: A shadow darted past the brightly lit window frame in front of Mr. Brunner's room. The shadow was much taller than the teacher who had spent his whole life in a wheelchair, holding something that looked very much like a bow.
tr_translation: A shadow passed in front of the light coming from the window on Brunner's door. This shadow was of something much, much taller than my teacher who sits in a wheelchair; it was holding a strange object resembling an archer's bow.
es_translation: A shadow crossed the illuminated glass of the office door, the shadow of something much taller than Brunner in his wheelchair, holding something that suspiciously resembled a bow.

en: Here was my favorite teacher, in front of the class, telling me I couldn’t handle it. After saying he believed in me all year, now he was telling me I was destined to get kicked out.
vi: Người thầy tôi kính trọng nhất đứng trước mặt cả lớp và bảo thẳng rằng tôi không có khả năng tiếp tục theo học được nữa. Suốt một năm qua thầy luôn tin tưởng tôi, vậy mà bây giờ thầy bảo số tôi thể nào cũng bị tống cổ khỏi trường.
tr: En sevdiğim öğretmenim tüm sınıfın önünde bana bu işi beceremediğimi söylüyordu. Tüm sene bana inandığını söylemişti, şimdiyse okuldan atılmamın alın yazım olduğunu söylüyordu.
es: Allí estaba mi profesor favorito, delante de la clase, diciéndome que no podía con aquello. Después de repetirme durante todo el año que creía en mí, ahora me salía con que estaba destinado a la patada.
vi_translation: The teacher I respect the most stood in front of the whole class and bluntly said that I was not capable of continuing my studies. For the past year, he always believed in me, yet now he says that I will definitely be expelled from school.
tr_translation: My favorite teacher was telling me in front of the whole class that I couldn't do this job. He had told me all year that he believed in me, but now he was saying that being expelled from school was my destiny.
es_translation: There was my favorite teacher, in front of the class, telling me that he couldn't handle it. After telling me all year that he believed in me, now he was saying that I was destined to fail.

en: The stuff on sale looked really good: heaping boxes of bloodred cherries and apples, walnuts and apricots, jugs of cider in a claw-foot tub full of ice. There were no customers, just three old ladies sitting in rocking chairs in the shade of a maple tree, knitting the biggest pair of socks I’d ever seen.
vi: Hàng hóa trong tiệm trông rất tươi ngon: nào anh đào và táo đỏ như màu máu, nào quả óc chó và mơ tươi mởn, nào rượu táo ướp lạnh đựng trong bình lớn. Tiệm không có khách, chỉ có ba bà già ngồi ở ghế bập bênh bên dưới tán cây gỗ thích, đang đan một đôi vớ lớn tôi chưa bao giờ thấy qua.
tr: Satılan meyveler gerçekten güzel gözüküyordu: kasalardan taşan kan kırmızı kirazlar ve elmalar, cevizler ve şeftaliler, ufak bir leğende buza yatırılmış elma suyu dolu sürahiler. Hiç müşteri yoktu, yalnızca bir akçaağacın gölgesinde, sallanan iskemlelerinde oturan üç tane yaşlı kadın vardı. Kadınlar, ömrümde gördüğüm en büyük çorapları örüyorlardı.
es: La mercancía tenía una pinta fenomenal: cajas de cerezas rojas como la sangre, y manzanas, nueces y albaricoques, jarras de sidra y una bañera con patas de garra llena de hielo. No había clientes, sólo tres ancianas sentadas en mecedoras a la sombra de un arce, tejiendo el par de calcetines más grande que he visto nunca.
vi_translation: The goods in the shop looked very fresh and delicious: cherries and apples as red as blood, fresh walnuts and apricots, and chilled apple cider stored in large jars. There were no customers in the shop, only three old women sitting on rocking chairs under the maple tree, knitting a large pair of socks that I had never seen before.
tr_translation: The fruits being sold looked truly beautiful: crimson red cherries and apples overflowing from crates, walnuts and peaches, pitchers full of apple juice set in a small basin filled with ice. There were no customers, only three elderly women sitting in rocking chairs under the shade of a maple tree. The women were knitting the largest socks I had ever seen in my life.
es_translation: The merchandise looked phenomenal: boxes of cherries as red as blood, and apples, nuts, and apricots, jugs of cider, and a clawfoot bathtub filled with ice. There were no customers, only three elderly women sitting in rocking chairs in the shade of a maple tree, knitting the largest pair of socks I have ever seen.

en: I mean these socks were the size of sweaters, but they were clearly socks. The lady on the right knitted one of them. The lady on the left knitted the other. The lady in the middle held an enormous basket of electric-blue yarn.
vi: Vớ gì mà rộng như áo len, nhưng hình dáng đúng là vớ đi chân. Bà ngồi bên phải đan một chiếc, bà ngồi bên trái đan chiếc kia. Bà ngồi giữa ôm chiếc rổ lớn đựng cuộn sợi xanh dương to tướng, trông như cuộn dây điện.
tr: Çorap dendiğine bakmayın, hepsinin büyüklüğü birer kazak kadar vardı ama besbelli ki çoraptı bunlar. Sağdaki hanım bir tekini örüyordu. Soldaki ise diğer tekini. Ortadaki ise içi çelik mavisi yünlerle dolu devasa bir sepet tutuyordu.
es: Me refiero a que tenían el tamaño de jerséis, pero eran claramente calcetines. La de la derecha tejía uno; la de la izquierda, otro. La del medio sostenía una enorme cesta de lana azul eléctrico.
vi_translation: Socks that are as wide as a sweater, but their shape is definitely that of socks for feet. The lady on the right is knitting one sock, the lady on the left is knitting the other. The lady in the middle is holding a large basket containing a huge blue yarn ball, which looks like a spool of electrical wire.
tr_translation: Don't be fooled by the term "socks," each one was as large as a sweater, but they were clearly socks. The lady on the right was knitting one of them. The one on the left was knitting the other one. The one in the middle was holding a gigantic basket filled with steel blue yarn.
es_translation: I mean, they were the size of sweaters, but they were clearly socks. The one on the right was knitting one; the one on the left, the other. The one in the middle was holding a huge basket of electric blue yarn.

en: See, they weren’t married. She told me he was rich and important, and their relationship was a secret. Then one day, he set sail across the Atlantic on some important journey, and he never came back.
vi: Chắc bạn đọc cũng hiểu: cha mẹ tôi không cưới xin gì hết. Mẹ bảo cha giàu có và là yếu nhân. Quan hệ của họ được giấu trong vòng bí mật. Thế rồi một ngày kia, cha lên tàu vượt biển Đại Tây Dương trong một chuyến công du khẩn cấp và không bao giờ trở lại.
tr: Anladınız değil mi, evlenmemişler. Annem, babamın zengin ve önemli birisi olduğunu, ilişkilerinin de gizli olduğunu söyledi. Sonra bir gün babam önemli bir gezi için Atlantik'i aşmak üzere yola çıkmış ve asla geri dönmemiş.
es: Verás, no estaban casados. Mi madre me contó que era rico e importante, y que su relación era secreta. Un buen día, él embarcó hacia el Atlántico en algún viaje importante y jamás regresó.
vi_translation: Surely, you also understand: my parents never got married. Mother said father was wealthy and an important person. Their relationship was kept a secret. Then one day, father boarded a ship to cross the Atlantic Ocean on an urgent mission and never returned.
tr_translation: They didn't get married. My mother said that my father was a rich and important person, and that their relationship was secret. Then one day, my father set out to cross the Atlantic for an important trip and never returned.
es_translation: You see, they were not married. My mother told me that he was rich and important, and that their relationship was secret. One fine day, he embarked towards the Atlantic on some important journey and never returned.

en: I wondered how she could say that. What was so great about me? A dyslexic, hyperactive boy with a D+ report card, kicked out of school for the sixth time in six years.
vi: Tôi tự hỏi sao mẹ có thể bình thản mà nói thế. Tôi có gì hay ho chứ? Chẳng qua tôi chỉ là học sinh cá biệt vừa mắc chứng hiếu động thái quá vừa bị bệnh khó đọc với tổng kết dưới mức trung bình, đã thế còn phải học lớp sáu những sáu năm và bị đuổi học những sáu lần.
tr: Nasıl olup da annemin bunu söylediğini anlayamıyordum. Neyimle gurur duyacaktı ki babam? Karnesi D+'larla dolu disleksik, hiperaktif bir çocuk, üstüne üstlük altı sene içerisinde altı kere okuldan atılmış.
es: Me pregunté cómo podía decir eso. ¿Qué tenía yo de fantástico? Era un crío hiperactivo y disléxico con un boletín de notas lleno de insuficientes, expulsado de la escuela por sexta vez en seis años.
vi_translation: I wonder how my mother can calmly say that. What's so special about me? I'm just a problematic student with both hyperactivity and dyslexia, with below-average grades. On top of that, I've had to repeat the sixth grade six times and have been expelled six times.
tr_translation: How could it be that my mother said this? What would my father be proud of? A dyslexic, hyperactive child with a report card full of D+'s, who had been expelled from school six times in six years.
es_translation: I wondered how he could say that. What was so fantastic about me? I was a hyperactive and dyslexic kid with a report card full of failing grades, expelled from school for the sixth time in six years.

en: As if on cue, the bull-man bellowed in rage. He picked up Gabe’s Camaro by the torn roof, the chassis creaking and groaning. He raised the car over his head and threw it down the road. It slammed into the wet asphalt and skidded in a shower of sparks for about half a mile before coming to a stop. The gas tank exploded.
vi: Y như rằng, con quái vật gầm lên giân dữ. Nó móc tay vào lỗ thủng trên nóc xe Camaro, nhấc bổng lên khiến khung gầm xe kêu loảng xoảng, đoạn giơ xe lên đầu trước khi ném xuống cuối đường. Xe va mạnh vào mặt đường nhựa và trượt dài một quãng xa trước khi dừng lại hẳn làm tia lửa bắn tung té. Thùng xăng nổ tung.
tr: Sanki bizi duymuş gibi öfkeyle kükredi boğa-adam. Tavanı delinmiş yerden Gabe'in Camaro'sunu kavradı; şasi gıcırdamaya, inlemeye başladı. Arabayı başının üstüne kaldırdı ve yoldan aşağı fırlattı. Araç ıslak asfalta çarptı ve durmadan önce kıvılcımlar saçarak neredeyse bir kilometre gitti. Ardından benzin deposu patladı.
es: Como si mamá le hubiera dado la entrada, el hombre toro aulló furioso. Agarró el Cámaro de Gabe por el techo rasgado, y el chasis crujió y se resquebrajó. Levantó el coche por encima de su cabeza y lo arrojó a la carretera, donde cayó sobre el asfalto mojado y patinó despidiendo chispas a lo largo de más de cien metros antes de detenerse. El tanque de gasolina explotó.
vi_translation: Sure enough, the monster roared angrily. It hooked its hand into the hole in the roof of the Camaro, lifted it up causing the chassis to clatter, then raised the car above its head before throwing it down the road. The car hit the asphalt hard and skidded a long distance before coming to a complete stop, sending sparks flying. The fuel tank exploded.
tr_translation: As if he had heard us, the bull-man roared with anger. He grabbed Gabe's Camaro from the spot where the ceiling had been broken; the chassis began to creak and groan. He lifted the car above his head and hurled it down the road. The vehicle hit the wet asphalt and went almost a kilometer, sparking all the way before it came to a stop. Then the gas tank exploded.
es_translation: As if mom had given him the cue, the bull-man howled furiously. He grabbed Gabe's Camaro by the torn roof, and the chassis creaked and cracked. He lifted the car above his head and threw it onto the road, where it landed on the wet asphalt and skidded, sparking for over a hundred meters before coming to a stop. The gas tank exploded.

en: We’d reached the crest of the hill. Down the other side I could see a valley, just as my mother had said, and the lights of a farmhouse glowing yellow through the rain. But that was half a mile away. We’d never make it.
vi: Chúng tôi đã lên đến đỉnh đồi. Tôi thấy thung lũng phía dưới hệt như lời mẹ kể, thấy cả căn nhà có đèn sáng lấp lánh trong mưa. Nhưng nơi ấy cách chúng tôi tám chín trăm mét. Chúng tôi sẽ không bao giờ đến đó được.
tr: Tepenin başına varmıştık. Diğer yanda vadiyi görüyordum, aşağıda tam annemin dediği gibi yağmurda sarı sıcak ışıklar saçan bir çiftlik evi vardı. Ama neredeyse bir kilometre uzaktaydı. Asla oraya ulaşamayacaktık.
es: Habíamos alcanzado la cresta de la colina. Al otro lado veía un valle, justo como había dicho mi madre, y las luces de una granja azotada por la lluvia. Pero estaba a unos trescientos metros. Jamás lo conseguiríamos.
vi_translation: We had reached the top of the hill. I saw the valley below just as my mother had described, and I saw the house with lights sparkling in the rain. But that place is eight or nine hundred meters away from us. We will never be able to get there.
tr_translation: We had reached the top of the hill. On the other side, I could see the valley, and below, just as my mother had said, there was a farmhouse emitting warm yellow lights in the rain. But it was almost a kilometer away. We would never be able to reach it.
es_translation: We had reached the crest of the hill. On the other side, I saw a valley, just as my mother had said, and the lights of a farm battered by the rain. But it was about three hundred meters away. We would never make it.

en: The bull-man staggered around, trying to shake me. I locked my arms around his horns to keep from being thrown. Thunder and lightning were still going strong. The rain was in my eyes. The smell of rotten meat burned my nostrils.
vi: Nó lảo đảo lùi lại, cố lắc người cho tôi rơi xuống đất. Nếu không ôm chặt hai sừng, chắc chắn tôi đã bị vưng xuống đất. Sấm chớp vẫn đì đùng như đại bác. Nước mưa tràn vào mắt khiến tôi không thể nhìn rõ. Đã thế mùi thịt thối rữa trên người nó xốc vào mũi làm tôi không sao chịu nổi.
tr: Boğa-adam sendeleyerek sağa sola sallandı, beni üstünden atmaya çalışıyordu. Düşmemek için kollarımı boynuzlarına doladım. Gök gürültüsü ve şimşekler daha da güçleniyordu. Gözlerime yağmur doluyordu. Burnuma çürük et kokusu dolmuştu.
es: El hombre toro se sacudió, intentando derribarme. Yo me aferré a sus cuernos para no acabar en tierra. Los rayos y truenos aún eran abundantes. La lluvia me nublaba la vista y el olor a carne podrida me quemaba la nariz.
vi_translation: It staggered back, trying to shake me off to the ground. If I hadn't held tightly to its horns, I would have certainly been thrown to the ground. Thunder and lightning still rumbled like cannons. Rainwater flooded into my eyes, making it impossible for me to see clearly. Moreover, the stench of rotting flesh on its body assaulted my nose, making it unbearable.
tr_translation: The bull-man staggered and swayed from side to side, trying to throw me off. I wrapped my arms around his horns to avoid falling. The thunder and lightning were getting stronger. Rain was filling my eyes. The smell of rotten meat filled my nose.
es_translation: The bull-man shook himself, trying to throw me off. I clung to his horns to avoid ending up on the ground. The lightning and thunder were still abundant. The rain blurred my vision and the smell of rotten flesh burned my nose.

en: A husky blond dude, like a surfer, stood in the corner of the bedroom keeping watch over me. He had blue eyes- at least a dozen of them-on his cheeks, his forehead, the backs of his hands.
vi: Một gã tóc bạch kim bảnh trai, vạm vỡ như vận động viên lướt sóng đứng cuối giường nhìn tôi chằm chằm. Mắt anh ta xanh biếc – ít nhất anh ta có hơn chục con mắt - mọc trên má, trán và mu bàn tay.
tr: Yatak odasının bir köşesinde sörfçü gençlere benzeyen, sarışın, gürbüz bir delikanlı vardı. Beni kolluyordu. Mavi gözleri vardı. Hem de en az on iki tane; yanaklarında, alnında, hatta ellerinin üstünde bile.
es: Un tipo rubio y fornido, con aspecto de surfero, estaba de pie en una esquina de la habitación, vigilándome. Tenía ojos azules —por lo menos una docena de ellos— en las mejillas, en la frente y en el dorso de las manos.
vi_translation: A handsome platinum-blonde guy, muscular like a surfer, stood at the end of the bed staring at me. His eyes were bright blue – at least a dozen of them – growing on his cheeks, forehead, and the back of his hands.
tr_translation: In a corner of the bedroom, there was a blond, robust young man who looked like a surfer. He was watching over me. He had blue eyes. At least twelve of them; on his cheeks, forehead, and even on the backs of his hands.
es_translation: A blond and burly guy, with a surfer look, was standing in a corner of the room, watching me. He had blue eyes —at least a dozen of them— on his cheeks, forehead, and the back of his hands.

en: I stared across the meadow. There were groves of trees, a winding stream, acres of strawberries spread out under the blue sky. The valley was surrounded by rolling hills, and the tallest one, directly in front of us, was the one with the huge pine tree on top. Even that looked beautiful in the sunlight.
vi: Tôi day mặt ra hướng đồng cỏ. Ở đó có nhữngcánh rừng nhỏ, có dòng suối uốn lượng và ruộng đất bát ngát trải tận chân trời. Thung lũng này lọt dưới quần thể đồi phủ cây xanh. Trước mặt chúng tôi là cây thông to lớn mọc sừng sững trên đỉnh đồi. Dù là cái cây đẹp đẽ được tắm mình trong nắng vàng như mật ong, trông nó vẫn ngạo nghễ thế nào ấy.
tr: Çayırın ötesine baktım. Koruluklar, döne döne giden bir ırmak, masmavi göğün altında dönüm dönüm çilek tarlaları vardı. Vadiyi engebeli tepeler sarmıştı. En yüksek tepe tam karşımızdaydı. En üstünde devasa bir çam ağacı vardı. Günışığı vurunca o bile güzel gözüküyordu.
es: Yo volví a contemplar el prado. Había arboledas, un arroyo serpenteante y hectáreas de campos de fresas que se extendían bajo el cielo azul. El valle estaba rodeado de colinas ondulantes, la más alta de las cuales, justo enfrente de nosotros, era la que tenía el enorme pino en la cumbre. Incluso aquello era bonito a la luz del día.
vi_translation: I turned my face towards the meadow. There were small forests, a winding stream, and vast fields stretching to the horizon. This valley nestled beneath a complex of green-covered hills. In front of us stood a large pine tree towering on the hilltop. Even though it was a beautiful tree bathed in golden sunlight like honey, it still looked somewhat arrogant.
tr_translation: I looked beyond the meadow. There were groves, a winding river, and acre upon acre of strawberry fields under the deep blue sky. The valley was surrounded by rugged hills. The highest hill was directly in front of us. At the very top, there was a gigantic pine tree. Even it looked beautiful when the sunlight hit it.
es_translation: I went back to gaze at the meadow. There were groves, a winding stream, and hectares of strawberry fields stretching under the blue sky. The valley was surrounded by rolling hills, the highest of which, right in front of us, was the one with the enormous pine at the summit. Even that was beautiful in the daylight.

en: We must’ve been on the north shore of Long Island, because on this side of the house, the valley marched all the way up to the water, which glittered about a mile in the distance. Between here and there, I simply couldn’t process everything I was seeing. The landscape was dotted with buildings that looked like ancient Greek architecture-an open-air pavilion, an amphitheater, a circular arena-except that they all looked brand new, their white marble columns sparkling in the sun. In a nearby sandpit, a dozen high school-age kids and satyrs played volleyball. Canoes glided across a small lake. Kids in bright orange T-shirts like Grover’s were chasing each other around a cluster of cabins nestled in the woods. Some shot targets at an archery range. Others rode horses down a wooded trail, and, unless I was hallucinating, some of their horses had wings.
vi: Tôi đoán chắc mình đang ở bờ bắc đảo Long Island. Bởi đứng từ đây, tôi thấy thung lũng trải dài đến bờ biển. Mặt biển lấp lánh cách nhà chừng hai cây số. Tôi không tin vào mắt mình khi ngắm quang cảnh từ đây đến đó. Rải rác trên bãi đất trống là những tòa kiến trúc xây theo lối Hy Lạp cổ: một nhà rạp giữa đồng trống, một khán đài vòng và một đấu trường hình tròn. Chỉ có diều, chúng đều rất mới. Những chiếc cột đá sáng bóng dưới nắng rực rỡ. Trong hố cát rộng gần đó, khoảng chục thiếu niên đang chơi bóng chuyền với các thần rừng. Trên mặt hồ nhỏ có vài chiếc xuồng máy đang lượn vòng. Đằng kia có lũ học trò mặc áo thun màu cam giống áo Grover đuổi nhau đùa nghịch quanh khu nhà gỗ lẩn khuất trong rừng thưa. Tôi còn thấy mấy tấm bia cho người tập bắn cung nữa. Xa xa có mấy người cưỡi ngựa đi xuống con đường mòn. Chắc tôi bị ảo giác hay sao mà thấy vài con ngựa còn mọc cánh nữa.
tr: Long Island'ın kuzey kıyısında olmalıydık çünkü evin bu yanında vadi denize uzanıyordu. Deniz bir buçuk kilometre ötede pırıl pırıl parlıyordu. Aradaki mesafede gördüğüm her şeyi algılamakta güçlük çekiyordum. Orada, burada antik Yunan mimarisine benzer yapılar vardı: Açık hava pavyonu,bir amfitiyatro, daire biçiminde bir arena. Ama hepsi yepyeniydi, beyaz mermer sütunları güneş ışığında parlıyordu. Yakındaki bir kum sahada bir düzine lise yaşı gelmiş çocuk ve satir voleybol oynuyordu. Ufacık bir gölde kanolar süzülüyordu. Kıvırcık'ın giydiğine benzer parlak turuncu tişörtler giymiş çocuklar, korulara dizilmiş, küme küme kulübelerin arasında birbirlerini kovalıyorlardı. Bazıları okçuluk alanında hedeflere ok sallıyordu. Diğerleri ağaçlarla çevrili bir patikada at sürüyordu ve eğer halüsinasyon görmüyorsam, bazı atların kanatları vardı.
es: Debíamos de estar en la orilla norte de Long Island, porque a ese lado de la casa el valle se fundía con el agua, que destellaba a lo largo de la costa. Lo que vi me sorprendió sobremanera. El paisaje estaba moteado de edificios que parecían arquitectura griega antigua —un pabellón al aire libre, un anfiteatro, un ruedo de arena—, pero con aspecto de recién construidos, con las columnas de mármol blanco relucientes al sol. En una pista de arena cercana había una docena de chicos y sátiros jugando al voleibol. Más allá, unas canoas se deslizaban por un lago cercano. Había niños vestidos con camisetas naranja como la de Grover, persiguiéndose unos a otros alrededor de un grupo de cabañas entre los árboles. Algunos disparaban con arco a unas dianas. Otros montaban a caballo por un sendero boscoso y, a menos que estuviera alucinando, algunas monturas tenían alas.
vi_translation: I am fairly certain that I am on the northern shore of Long Island. Because from here, I can see the valley stretching out to the coast. The sparkling sea is about two kilometers away from the house. I couldn't believe my eyes when I gazed at the scenery from here to there. Scattered across the open land are buildings constructed in the ancient Greek style: a pavilion in the middle of the field, an amphitheater, and a circular arena. Only thing is, they all look very new. The stone columns gleam under the bright sunlight. In a nearby large sandpit, about a dozen teenagers are playing volleyball with forest spirits. On the small lake, a few motorboats are circling around. Over there, students wearing orange T-shirts similar to Grover's are chasing each other and playing around the wooden cabins hidden in the sparse forest. I also see some targets for archery practice. In the distance, a few people are riding horses down the trail. I must be hallucinating because I see some of the horses even have wings.
tr_translation: We must have been on the north shore of Long Island because the valley extended to the sea on this side of the house. The sea was sparkling brightly a kilometer and a half away. I was having difficulty perceiving everything I saw in the distance. Here and there, there were structures resembling ancient Greek architecture: an open-air pavilion, an amphitheater, a circular arena. But they were all brand new, with white marble columns gleaming in the sunlight. On a nearby sandy field, a dozen high school-aged kids and satyrs were playing volleyball. Canoes were gliding on a tiny lake. Kids wearing bright orange T-shirts similar to what Curly was wearing were lined up in the groves, chasing each other among clusters of cabins. Some were shooting arrows at targets in the archery range. Others were riding horses on a path surrounded by trees, and if I wasn't hallucinating, some of the horses had wings.
es_translation: We must have been on the north shore of Long Island because on that side of the house the valley merged with the water, which sparkled along the coast. What I saw surprised me greatly. The landscape was dotted with buildings that looked like ancient Greek architecture —an open-air pavilion, an amphitheater, a sand arena— but they appeared newly built, with the white marble columns gleaming in the sun. On a nearby sand court, there were a dozen kids and satyrs playing volleyball. Beyond that, some canoes were gliding across a nearby lake. There were children dressed in orange T-shirts like Grover's, chasing each other around a group of cabins among the trees. Some were shooting arrows at targets. Others were riding horses along a wooded trail and, unless I was hallucinating, some of the mounts had wings.

en: The Latin teacher turned and smiled at me. His eyes had that mischievous glint they sometimes got in class when he pulled a pop quiz and made all the multiple choice answers B.
vi: Thầy giáo Latinh quay lại nhìn tôi mỉm cười. Cặp mắt ông tinh nghịch giống đôi lần trong lớp, ông bất thần cho lớp làm bài kiểm tra đột xuất, hoặc soạn lựa chọn đúng cho mọi câu hỏi đều là B.
tr: Latince hocam dönüp gülümsedi. Gözlerinde, tıpkı habersiz sınav yapıp tüm çoktan seçmeli yanıtları B olarak ayarladığı zamanki gibi hınzırca bir parıltı vardı.
es: El profesor de latín se volvió y me sonrió. Sus ojos tenían el brillo travieso que le aparecía a veces en clase, cuando hacía una prueba sorpresa y todas las respuestas coincidían con la opción B.
vi_translation: The Latin teacher turned back and smiled at me. His eyes were mischievous, just like those times in class when he suddenly gave us a surprise test or made all the correct answers to every question be B.
tr_translation: My Latin teacher turned and smiled. In his eyes, there was a mischievous sparkle, just like when he gave an unannounced test and set all the multiple-choice answers to B.
es_translation: The Latin teacher turned around and smiled at me. His eyes had the mischievous sparkle that sometimes appeared in class when he gave a surprise quiz and all the answers matched option B.

en: She glanced at the minotaur horn in my hands, then back at me. I imagined she was going to say, You killed a minotaur! or Wow, you’re so awesome! or something like that.
vi: Annabeth hết nhìn sừng quỷ đầu bò lại nhìn tôi. Tôi thầm mơ người đẹp sẽ trầm trồ: “Trời, bạn hạ quái vật đầu bò cơ à ?” hoặc “Ôi, bạn thật dũng mãnh!” hay câu gì tương tự. Ngược lại, Annabeth “bóc mẽ”:
tr: Elimdeki Minotor boynuzuna şöyle bir baktı, sonra başını bana çevirdi. Şöyle diyecek zannediyordum: Bir Minotor öldürdün ha! Vay be, muhteşemsin! veya buna benzer şeyler işte.
es: Echó un vistazo a mi cuerno de minotauro y me miró a los ojos. Supuse que iba a decir algo como: «¡Vaya, has matado un minotauro!», o «¡Uau, eres un fenómeno!». Pero sólo dijo:
vi_translation: Annabeth looked from the bull-horn to me. I secretly dreamed that the beautiful girl would exclaim: "Wow, you defeated the Minotaur?" or "Oh, you are so brave!" or something like that. On the contrary, Annabeth "exposed":
tr_translation: He looked at the Minotaur horn in my hand, then turned his head towards me. I thought he would say: You killed a Minotaur, huh! Wow, you're amazing! or something like that.
es_translation: He glanced at my minotaur horn and looked me in the eyes. I supposed he was going to say something like: "Wow, you killed a minotaur!" or "Wow, you're amazing!" But he only said:

en: We passed the volleyball pit. Several of the campers nudged each other. One pointed to the minotaur horn I was carrying. Another said, “That’s him.”
vi: Hai chúng tôi đi ngang qua bãi bóng chuyền. Mấy bạn cùng cắm trại huýnh nhau. Có người chỉ chỏ sừng quỷ đầu bò trong tay tôi, người khác bảo: “Chính cậu ta đấy.”
tr: Voleybol sahasından geçtik. Kampçılardan bir kısmı birbirlerini dürttü. Bir tanesi elimdeki Minotor boynuzuna işaret etti, diğeri de "Bu o," dedi.
es: Pasamos junto al campo de voleibol y algunos chicos se dieron codazos. Uno señaló el cuerno de minotauro que yo llevaba. Otro dijo: «Es él.»
vi_translation: We both walked past the volleyball court. The friends camping together started fighting. Someone pointed at the bull demon horn in my hand, another said: "It's him."
tr_translation: We passed through the volleyball court. Some of the campers nudged each other. One of them pointed to the Minotaur horn in my hand, and another said, "That's him."
es_translation: We passed by the volleyball court and some kids nudged each other. One pointed at the minotaur horn I was carrying. Another said, "It's him."

en: She showed me a few more places: the metal shop (where kids were forging their own swords), the arts-and-crafts room (where satyrs were sandblasting a giant marble statue of a goat-man), and the climbing wall, which actually consisted of two facing walls that shook violently, dropped boulders, sprayed lava, and clashed together if you didn’t get to the top fast enough.
vi: Bạn ấy chỉ tôi xem vài chỗ nữa: xưởng kim loại có mấy bạn đang tự rèn kiếm, phòng thủ công có thần rừng đang thổi cát đánh bóng bức tượng bằng đá cẩm thạch khổng lồ, tạc hình một nhân vật nửa người, nửa dê và bức tường luyện tập. Tường này có hai mảnh rung chuyển mạnh, đá tảng theo nhau lăn xuống như mưa, nham thạch nóng bắn tung tóe. Nếu học viên không leo nhanh sẽ bị bỏng vì nham thạch.
tr: Annabeth bana birkaç yer daha gösterdi: metal atölyesi (burada çocuklar kendi kılıçlarını dövüyordu), sanat ve zanaat odası (içeride satirler mermerden bir keçi-adam heykelini zımparalıyorlardı) ve ürmanma duvarı. Tırmanma duvarı aslında birbirine karşıt iki duvardan oluşuyordu. Duvarlar sürekli sallanıyor, üzerlerinden kayalar dökülüyor, lavlar sıçrıyor ve yeterince hızla yukarı çıkamazsanız birbirlerine çarpıyorlardı.
es: Me enseñó unos cuantos sitios más: el taller de metal (donde los chicos forjaban sus propias espadas), el taller de artes y oficios (donde los sátiros pulían una estatua de mármol gigante de un hombre cabra), el rocódromo, que en realidad consistía en dos muros enfrentados que se sacudían violentamente, arrojaban piedras, despedían lava y chocaban uno contra otro si no llegabas arriba con la suficiente celeridad.
vi_translation: He showed me a few more places: the metal workshop where some friends were forging swords, the handicraft room where a forest spirit was blowing sand to polish a giant marble statue, carving a figure that was half-human, half-goat, and the training wall. This wall had two sections that shook violently, boulders rolling down like rain, and hot lava splattering everywhere. If the trainees didn't climb quickly, they would get burned by the lava.
tr_translation: Annabeth showed me a few more places: the metal workshop (where kids were forging their own swords), the arts and crafts room (inside, satyrs were sanding a marble statue of a goat-man), and the climbing wall. The climbing wall actually consisted of two opposing walls. The walls were constantly shaking, rocks were falling from them, lava was splashing, and if you couldn't climb up fast enough, they would crash into each other.
es_translation: He showed me a few more places: the metal workshop (where the boys forged their own swords), the arts and crafts workshop (where the satyrs polished a giant marble statue of a goat-man), the climbing wall, which actually consisted of two opposing walls that shook violently, threw stones, spewed lava, and crashed into each other if you didn't reach the top quickly enough.

en: She looked at me skeptically, and I realized it was my fault. I’d made water shoot out of the bathroom fixtures. I didn’t understand how. But the toilets had responded to me. I had become one with the plumbing.
vi: Thấy ánh mắt nghi ngờ của cô bạn tóc vàng, tôi mới hiểu cơ sự tại tôi cả. Chính tôi điều khiển nước phụt ra từ các thiết bị dọc đường ống gắn trên tường. Tôi không hiểu bằng cách nào nhưng thủ phạm chính là tôi. Bồn cầu biết nhận lệnh tôi. Hóa ra tôi có ảnh hưởng đến chuyện ống nước gì gì đó.
tr: Şüpheyle bana bakü, aslında benim hatam olduğunu anladım. Tuvalet tesisatından su fışkırmasını sağlayan kişibendim. Nasıl olmuştu, anlamamıştım. Ama tuvaletler dileklerimi yerine getirmişti. Tesisatla bir olmuştum.
es: Me miró con aire escéptico, y reparé en que sí había sido culpa mía. Había provocado que el agua saliera disparada desde todos los grifos. No entendía cómo, pero los baños me habían respondido. Las tuberías y yo nos habíamos convertido en uno.
vi_translation: Seeing the doubtful look in my blonde friend's eyes, I realized it was all because of me. I was the one controlling the water spraying out from the devices along the pipes attached to the wall. I don't understand how, but the culprit was me. The toilet obeyed my commands. It turned out I had an influence on the water pipes or something like that.
tr_translation: Looking at me with suspicion, I realized it was actually my fault. I was the one who caused the water to gush from the toilet plumbing. I didn't understand how it had happened. But the toilets had granted my wishes. I had become one with the plumbing.
es_translation: He looked at me skeptically, and I realized that it had indeed been my fault. I had caused the water to shoot out from all the faucets. I didn't understand how, but the bathrooms had responded to me. The pipes and I had become one.

en: She clenched her fists. “I wish I knew. Chiron and the satyrs, they know, but they won’t tell me. Something is wrong in Olympus, something pretty major. Last time I was there, everything seemed so normal.”
vi: Annabeth nắm chặt hai bàn tay: - Giá tớ biết thì hay quá. Chiron và nhóm thần rừng biết nhưng không cho tớ hay. Hình như đỉnh Olympia có chuyện chẳng lành… Lần này nghiêm trọng đấy. Lần cuối cùng tớ đến đó, mọi thứ còn êm ả. Vậy mà… - Cậu đã lên tận đấy rồi ư?
tr: Annabeth yumruklarını sıktı. "Keşke bilsem. Kheiron ve satirler biliyorlar ama bana söylemiyorlar. Olimpos'ta bir şeyler yolunda gitmiyor, çok önemli bir şeyler dönüyor. Gerçi oraya son gittiğimde her şey son derece normaldi.
es: ¿A qué se refería? —Ojalá lo supiera. Quirón y los sátiros lo saben, pero no tienen intención de contármelo. Algo va mal en el Olimpo, algo importante. La última vez que estuve allí todo parecía tan normal...
vi_translation: Annabeth clenched her fists tightly. - If only I knew, that would be great. Chiron and the satyrs know but won't tell me. It seems like something bad is happening on Mount Olympus... This time it's serious. The last time I went there, everything was still peaceful. But now... - You went all the way up there?
tr_translation: Annabeth clenched her fists. "I wish I knew. Chiron and the satyrs know, but they won't tell me. Something is not right on Olympus, something very important is going on. Though, the last time I went there, everything seemed perfectly normal."
es_translation: What was he referring to? —I wish I knew. Chiron and the satyrs know, but they have no intention of telling me. Something is wrong on Olympus, something important. The last time I was there everything seemed so normal...

en: My fingers curled around the Minotaur’s horn. I thought about my mom, but I had good thoughts: her smile, the bedtime stories she would read me when I was a kid, the way she would tell me not to let the bedbugs bite.
vi: Tay tôi nắm chặt chiếc sừng kỷ niệm. Trong một thoáng, mọi ký ức đẹp đẽ về mẹ ùa tới: nụ cười dịu dàng, cuốn truyện mẹ đọc cho tôi đi ngủ hồi tôi còn bé… Tôi nhớ cả cách mẹ dạy làm thế nào để khỏi bị rệp cắn khi đi ngủ.
tr: Parmaklarım Minotor boynuzunu sardı. Annemi düşündüm ama aklımda güzel şeyler vardı: gülüşü, çocukken yatmadan önce okuduğu masallar, tatlı rüyalar deyişi.
es: Mis dedos se cerraron alrededor del cuerno del Minotauro. Pensé en mi madre, pero sólo tuve buenos pensamientos: su sonrisa, las historias que me leía antes de irme a la cama cuando era pequeño, la manera en que me decía que no dejara que me picaran los mosquitos.
vi_translation: My hand tightly grasped the commemorative horn. In a moment, all the beautiful memories of my mother came rushing in: her gentle smile, the book she read to me at bedtime when I was little... I even remembered how she taught me to avoid getting bitten by bedbugs when going to sleep.
tr_translation: My fingers wrapped around the Minotaur's horn. I thought of my mother, but there were beautiful things in my mind: her smile, the stories she read before bed when I was a child, her saying sweet dreams.
es_translation: My fingers closed around the Minotaur's horn. I thought of my mother, but I only had good thoughts: her smile, the stories she read to me before bed when I was little, the way she told me not to let the mosquitoes bite me.

en: The next few days I settled into a routine that felt almost normal, if you don’t count the fact that I was getting lessons from satyrs, nymphs, and a centaur.
vi: Mấy ngày sau đó, sinh hoạt của tôi dần đi vào nề nếp, giống hồi ở trường thường. Chỉ có điều, người hướng dẫn tôi bây giờ là thần rừng, Nữ Thần Cây và nhân mã.
tr: Sonraki birkaç günde düzene öyle bir alışmıştım ki, her şey olağan gelmeye başlamıştı. Satirlerden, nimfelerden ve bir sentordan ders aldığımı saymazsak tabii.
es: Los siguientes días me acostumbré a una rutina que casi parecía normal, si exceptuamos el hecho de que me daban clase sátiros, ninfas y un centauro.
vi_translation: In the following days, my routine gradually fell into place, similar to when I was at regular school. The only difference was that my guides now were the forest god, the Tree Goddess, and the centaur.
tr_translation: In the next few days, I had gotten so used to the routine that everything started to seem ordinary. Except for the fact that I was taking lessons from satyrs, nymphs, and a centaur, of course.
es_translation: The following days I got used to a routine that almost seemed normal, except for the fact that I was being taught by satyrs, nymphs, and a centaur.

en: The only thing I really excelled at was canoeing, and that wasn’t the kind of heroic skill people expected to see from the kid who had beaten the Minotaur.
vi: - Tưởng con ông nọ bà kia là “ngầu” lắm sao? Tôi chỉ thạo mỗi trò lái xuồng máy. Đó chẳng phải kỹ năng của người hùng. Người ta kỳ vọng ở anh chàng giết quỷ đầu bò nhiều hơn thế.
tr: Gerçekten kusursuz yaptığım iş, kanoda kürek çekmekti. Gerçi bu da Minotor'u yenebilmiş bir çocuktan beklenen kahramanca hüner değildi.
es: En lo único en que sobresalía era la canoa, que desde luego no era la clase de habilidad heroica que la gente esperaba descubrir en el chico que había derrotado al Minotauro.
vi_translation: - Do you think being a "big shot's kid" is that impressive? I'm only good at driving motorboats. That's not a hero's skill. People expect more from the guy who slays minotaurs.
tr_translation: The one thing I did perfectly was rowing a canoe. However, this was not the kind of heroic skill expected from a child who had defeated the Minotaur.
es_translation: The only thing he excelled at was canoeing, which certainly wasn't the kind of heroic skill people expected to find in the boy who had defeated the Minotaur.

en: Despite all that, I liked camp. I got used to the morning fog over the beach, the smell of hot strawberry fields in the afternoon, even the weird noises of monsters in the woods at night. I would eat dinner with cabin eleven, scrape part of my meal into the fire, and try to feel some connection to my real dad. Nothing came. Just that warm feeling I’d always had, like the memory of his smile. I tried not to think too much about my mom, but I kept wondering: if gods and monsters were real, if all this magical stuff was possible, surely there was some way to save her, to bring her back….
vi: Dù thế, tôi vẫn thích trại hè, tôi dần quyến luyến với sương sớm phủ trắng bãi biển, hương dâu thơm lừng mỗi chiều, và tiếng động lạ lẫm từ trong rừng vọng tới hàng đêm. Lúc dùng bữa ở bàn ăn của Nhà Số Mười Một, gạt một phần thức ăn trong đĩa vào lửa, tôi cố tìm mối liên hệ với người cha ruột của mình. Chẳng có gì ngoại trừ cảm giác ấm áp, giống ký ức về nụ cười của cha.
tr: Tüm bunlara karşın kampı sevmiştim. Sabahları sahile çöken sise, hatta geceleri koruluktaki tuhaf canavar gürültülerine dahi alışmıştım. On bir numaralı kulübede yemeğimi yiyor, tabaktaki yemeğimi sıyırıp ateşe atıyor, gerçek babamla iletişim kurmaya çalışıyordum. Ama hiçbir şey olmuyordu. Sadece her zaman içime düşen o sıcak his, babamın gülümseyişine dair anılar... Annemi çok düşünmemeye çalışıyordum ama merak ettiğim bir şey vardı: madem tanrılar da canavarlar da gerçekti, madem tüm bu sihirli şeyler mümkündü, o halde muhakkak ki onu kurtarmanın, onu geri döndürmenin bir yolu olmalıydı...
es: A pesar de todo, me gustaba el campamento. Pronto me acostumbré a la neblina matutina sobre la playa, al aroma de los campos de fresas por la tarde, incluso a los sonidos raros de los monstruos de los bosques por la noche. Cenaba con los de la cabaña 11, echaba parte de mi comida al fuego e intentaba sentir algún tipo de conexión con mi padre real. No percibí nada, sólo el sentimiento cálido que siempre había tenido, como el recuerdo de su sonrisa. Intentaba no pensar demasiado en mamá, pero seguía repitiéndome: «Si los dioses y los monstruos son reales, si todas estas historias mágicas son posibles, seguro que hay manera de salvarla, de devolverla a la vida...»
vi_translation: Despite that, I still liked the summer camp; I gradually became attached to the early morning mist covering the beach, the fragrant scent of strawberries every afternoon, and the strange noises echoing from the forest every night. While having a meal at the table of House Number Eleven, pushing a portion of food from the plate into the fire, I tried to find a connection with my biological father. There was nothing except a warm feeling, like the memory of my father's smile.
tr_translation: Despite all this, I had come to love the camp. I had even gotten used to the mist that settled on the beach in the mornings, and the strange monster noises in the grove at night. I ate my meals in cabin eleven, scraped my plate clean and threw it into the fire, trying to communicate with my real father. But nothing was happening. Only that warm feeling that always settled inside me, the memories of my father's smile... I tried not to think about my mother too much, but there was something I wondered: if gods and monsters were real, if all these magical things were possible, then surely there must be a way to save her, to bring her back...
es_translation: Despite everything, I liked the camp. Soon I got used to the morning mist over the beach, the aroma of the strawberry fields in the afternoon, even the strange sounds of the monsters in the woods at night. I dined with those from cabin 11, threw part of my food into the fire, and tried to feel some kind of connection with my real father. I didn't perceive anything, just the warm feeling I had always had, like the memory of his smile. I tried not to think too much about mom, but I kept telling myself: "If gods and monsters are real, if all these magical stories are possible, surely there is a way to save her, to bring her back to life..."

en: We started with basic stabbing and slashing, using some straw-stuffed dummies in Greek armor. I guess I did okay. At least, I understood what I was supposed to do and my reflexes were good.
vi: Bài học bắt đầu bằng vài động tác đâm và vung kiếm cơ bản. Chúng tôi dùng bù nhìn nhồi rơm mặc giáp trụ giống chiến binh Hy Lạp cổ để tập. Tôi học không tồi. Tập hồi lâu, tôi biết mình phải làm gì. Sự hồi tưởng về những trận đánh xa xưa cũng khá rõ ràng.
tr: Yunan zırhları giydirilmiş kuklalar üzerinde temel saplama ve biçme hareketleriyle işe başladık. Sanırım fena değildim. En azından ne yapacağımı anlamıştım, reflekslerim de iyiydi.
es: Empezamos con los tajos y las estocadas básicas, practicando con muñecos de paja con armadura griega. Supongo que no lo hice mal. Por lo menos, entendí lo que se suponía que debía hacer y mis reflejos eran buenos.
vi_translation: The lesson began with a few basic thrusting and slashing movements. We used straw-stuffed dummies dressed in armor resembling ancient Greek warriors to practice. I didn't learn poorly. After practicing for a long time, I knew what I had to do. The recollection of ancient battles was also quite clear.
tr_translation: We started with basic thrusting and slashing movements on mannequins dressed in Greek armor. I think I wasn't too bad. At least I understood what to do, and my reflexes were good.
es_translation: We started with basic slashes and thrusts, practicing with straw dummies wearing Greek armor. I suppose I didn't do too badly. At the very least, I understood what I was supposed to do and my reflexes were good.

en: “Right. You know. After the great battle with the Titans, they took over the world from their dad and drew lots to decide who got what.”
vi: - Chính xác. Chắc cậu cũng biết, đánh bại các người khổng lồ Titan xong, họ chiếm ngai vàng của cha và rút thăm chia quyền cát cứ.
tr: "Tamam. Biliyormuşsun. Titanlarla olan büyük savaştan sonra dünyayı babalarının ellerinden aldılar ve kim neyi alacak diye çöp çektiler.
es: —Exacto. Veo que estás al loro. Tras la gran batalla contra los titanes, le quitaron el mundo a su padre y se echaron a suertes a quién le tocaba cada cosa.
vi_translation: - Exactly. You probably know that after defeating the Titans, they took their father's throne and drew lots to divide the realms.
tr_translation: "Alright. You knew. After the great war with the Titans, they took the world from their fathers' hands and drew lots to decide who would take what."
es_translation: —Exactly. I see you're on top of things. After the great battle against the Titans, they took the world from their father and drew lots to see who would get what.

en: We cheered and shook our swords and followed her down the path to the south woods. The red team yelled taunts at us as they headed off toward the north.
vi: Cả đội hò reo, vung kiếm theo Annabeth theo đường mòn xuống phía nam khu rừng. Ðội đỏ vừa tiến về phương Bắc vừa mắng nhiếc xỉ vả chúng tôi.
tr: Hep beraber bağırdık, kılıçlarımızı salladık ve onun peşinde güney koruluğa giden patikadan aşağı inmeye başladık. Kırmızı takım sinirlerimizi bozmak için küfürler savurup kuzeye yol aldı.
es: Vitoreamos, agitamos nuestras armas y la seguimos por el camino hacia la parte sur del bosque. El equipo rojo nos provocaba a gritos mientras se encaminaba hacia el norte.
vi_translation: The whole team cheered, swinging their swords as they followed Annabeth down the trail to the south of the forest. The red team advanced north while hurling insults at us.
tr_translation: We all shouted together, waved our swords, and began to descend the path leading to the southern grove in pursuit of him. The red team hurled curses to rattle our nerves and headed north.
es_translation: We cheered, waved our weapons, and followed her down the path towards the southern part of the forest. The red team taunted us with shouts as they headed north.

en: There on the rocks just above us was a black hound the size of a rhino, with lava-red eyes and fangs like daggers.
vi: Ngay trên đống đá tảng sừng sững trước mặt chúng tôi có con chó săn đen trũi, to bằng con tê giác, mắt vằn đỏ như máu, bộ nanh sắc như dao.
tr: Hemen tepemizdeki kayaların üzerinde bir gergedan büyüklüğünde, kara mı kara bir tazı vardı. Gözleri lav gibi parlıyordu, dişleriyse bir hançer büyüklüğündeydi.
es: En las rocas situadas encima de nosotros había un enorme perro negro, con ojos rojos como la lava y colmillos que parecían dagas.
vi_translation: Right on the towering pile of rocks in front of us was a jet-black hunting dog, as big as a rhinoceros, with blood-red eyes and teeth as sharp as knives.
tr_translation: There was a pitch-black hound, the size of a rhinoceros, on the rocks right above us. Its eyes were glowing like lava, and its teeth were the size of daggers.
es_translation: On the rocks above us, there was a huge black dog with eyes as red as lava and fangs that looked like daggers.

en: By some miracle, I was still alive. I didn’t want to look underneath the ruins of my shredded armor. My chest felt warm and wet, and I knew I was badly cut. Another second, and the monster would’ve turned me into a hundred pounds of delicatessen meat.
vi: Tôi còn sống như có phép màu. Tôi sợ không dám nhìn xuống tấm áo giáp tả tơi. Thấy ngực mình ươn ướt, âm ấm, tôi biết mình bị thương nặng. Chỉ chậm một giây thôi là quái thú sẽ biến tôi thành súc thịt vô tri nặng năm chục ký lô.
tr: Mucize kabilinden hayattaydım. Lime lime olmuş zırhımın altına bakacak gücüm yoktu. Göğsüm yanıyordu ve ıpıslaktı, çok kötü yaralandığımı biliyordum. Bir saniye gecikseler, canavar beni elli kiloluk kıymaya çevirirdi.
es: Por algún milagro, yo seguía vivo. No quise mirar debajo de mi armadura despedazada. Sentía el pecho caliente y húmedo, sin duda tenía cortes muy feos. Un segundo más y el animal me habría convertido en picadillo fino.
vi_translation: I am still alive as if by a miracle. I am too scared to look down at my tattered armor. Feeling my chest wet and warm, I know I am seriously injured. Just a second slower and the beast would have turned me into fifty kilograms of lifeless meat.
tr_translation: I was alive by a miracle. I had no strength to look under my shredded armor. My chest was burning and soaking wet; I knew I was badly injured. If they had been a second late, the monster would have turned me into fifty kilos of minced meat.
es_translation: By some miracle, I was still alive. I didn't want to look under my shattered armor. I felt my chest hot and wet, undoubtedly I had some very nasty cuts. One more second and the animal would have turned me into fine mince.

en: The attic was filled with Greek hero junk: armor stands covered in cobwebs; once-bright shields pitted with rust; old leather steamer trunks plastered with stickers saying ITHAKA, CIRCE’S ISLE, and LAND OF THE AMAZONS. One long table was stacked with glass jars filled with pickled things-severed hairy claws, huge yellow eyes, various other parts of monsters. A dusty mounted trophy on the wall looked like a giant snake’s head, but with horns and a full set of shark’s teeth. The plaque read, HYDRA HEAD #1, WOODSTOCK, N.Y., 1969.
vi: Căn gác xép bừa bội đồ đạc hư hỏng của chiến binh Hy Lạp cổ: bộ giáp trụ vùi trong đống mạng nhện, vài cái khiên rỉ sét, mấy hòm xiểng lớn bằng da nhằng nhịt giấy dán những chữ như: Ithaka, Quần Đảo Vòng và Vùng Đất Của Các Nữ Vương. Một chiếc bàn dài xếp dầy hũ thủy tinh đựng đồ ngâm dấm: vài móng thú đầy lông, đống tròng mắt vàng khè, to như chén tống và nhiều bộ phận cơ thể của quái vật. Một chiếc cúp bám đầy bụi treo trên tường trông giống đầu rắn nhưng lại có sừng, miệng đầy răng cá mập. Tấm bảng đồng bên dưới đề: Đầu thứ nhất của Hydra, Woodstock, NY, 1969.
tr: Tavan arası Yunan kahramanlardan kalma çerçöple doluydu: örümcek ağları ile kaplı zırhlıklar; vaktiyle parlakken, pastan çukur çukur olmuş kalkanlar; üstlerine İTHAKA, KİRKE ADASI ve AMAZONLAR DİYARI yazan çıkartmalarla bezeli, deri kaplı eski sandıklar. Uzunca bir masanın üstündeise turşusu kurulmuş şeyler ile dolu cam kavanozlar diziliydi: üstü kıllarla kaplı kopmuş, kocaman sarı gözler, başka çeşitli canavar parçaları. Duvara tutturulmuş, içi doldurulmuş bir kafanın her yanı tozla kaplıydı. Bu kafa dev bir yılanın kafasına benziyordu ama boynuzları ve köpekbalığı dişleri vardı. Altındaki levhada şöyle yazıyordu: HİDRA KAFASI No: 1, WOODSTOCK, NEW YORK, 1969.
es: El ático estaba lleno de trastos viejos de héroes griegos: armaduras cubiertas de telarañas; escudos antaño relucientes y ahora manchados de orín; baúles viejos de cuero con pegatinas en las que se leía: «ÍTACA», «isla de circe» y «PAÍS DE las AMAZONAS». Había una mesa larga atestada de tarros con cosas encurtidas: garras peludas troceadas, enormes ojos amarillos, distintas partes de monstruo. En la pared destacaba un trofeo polvoriento; parecía la cabeza gigante de una serpiente, pero tenía cuernos y una fila entera de dientes de tiburón. En la placa ponía: «cabeza n.° i de la hidra, woods TOCK, N. Y., 1969.»
vi_translation: The cluttered attic of a Greek warrior's damaged belongings: armor buried in cobwebs, a few rusty shields, several large leather chests covered with labels bearing words like: Ithaka, the Cyclades, and the Land of the Queens. A long table filled with glass jars containing pickled items: a few furry animal claws, a pile of yellowish eyeballs as big as bowls, and many body parts of monsters. A dust-covered trophy hanging on the wall that looks like a snake's head but has horns and a mouth full of shark teeth. The brass plaque underneath reads: First head of the Hydra, Woodstock, NY, 1969.
tr_translation: The attic was filled with junk from Greek heroes: armor covered in cobwebs; shields that were once shiny but now pitted with rust; old leather-covered chests adorned with stickers reading ITHACA, CIRCE'S ISLAND, and LAND OF THE AMAZONS. On a long table, there were glass jars filled with pickled things: huge yellow eyes covered in hair, various other monster parts. A stuffed head mounted on the wall was covered in dust. This head resembled that of a giant snake but had horns and shark teeth. The plaque beneath it read: HYDRA HEAD No: 1, WOODSTOCK, NEW YORK, 1969.
es_translation: The attic was full of old junk from Greek heroes: armors covered in cobwebs; shields once shiny and now stained with rust; old leather trunks with stickers that read: "ITHACA," "island of circe," and "LAND OF the AMAZONS." There was a long table crowded with jars of pickled things: chopped hairy claws, huge yellow eyes, various monster parts. On the wall, a dusty trophy stood out; it looked like the giant head of a serpent, but it had horns and an entire row of shark teeth. On the plaque it said: "head no. i of the hydra, woods TOCK, N. Y., 1969."

en: I got the feeling there was a lot he wasn’t telling me about his prophecy, but I decided I couldn’t worry about that right now. After all, I was holding back information too.
vi: Biết bác Chiron giấu nhiều chi tiết của lời tiên đoán tương lai đã nghe lúc trước, nhưng tôi quyết định tạm gác chuyện đó lại. Nói cho cùng, chính tôi cũng không nói hết cơ mà.
tr: Bana kendi kehaneti ile ilgili söylemediği çok şey olduğunu hissediyordum ama şimdi bunu dert edemem diye düşündüm. Ne de olsa benim de söylemediklerim vardı.
es: Intuí que me estaba ocultando buena parte de su profecía, pero decidí que ahora no podía preocuparme por eso. Después de todo, también yo me estaba guardando información.
vi_translation: Knowing that Mr. Chiron had hidden many details of the future prediction he had heard earlier, I decided to set that matter aside for now. After all, I didn't reveal everything either.
tr_translation: I felt that there were many things he hadn't told me about his prophecy, but I thought I couldn't worry about that now. After all, I had things I hadn't said either.
es_translation: I sensed that he was hiding a good part of his prophecy from me, but I decided that I couldn't worry about that now. After all, I was also keeping information to myself.

en: “The entrance to the Underworld is always in the west. It moves from age to age, just like Olympus. Right now, of course, it’s in America.”
vi: - Lối vào cõi âm luôn ở hướng Tây. Giống đỉnh Olympia, nó cũng chuyển địa điểm theo thời gian. Tất nhiên lúc này nó ở Mỹ.
tr: "Yeraltı Dünyası'na giriş her zaman batıdadır. Çağdan çağa yer değiştirir, tıpkı Olimpos gibi. Elbette şimdi Amerika'da.
es: —La entrada al inframundo está siempre en el oeste. Se desplaza de época en época, como el Olimpo. Justo ahora, por supuesto, está en Estados Unidos.
vi_translation: - The entrance to the underworld is always in the West. Like Mount Olympus, it also changes location over time. Of course, right now it is in America.
tr_translation: "The entrance to the Underworld is always in the west. It changes location from age to age, just like Olympus. Of course, now it is in America."
es_translation: —The entrance to the underworld is always in the west. It shifts from era to era, like Olympus. Right now, of course, it's in the United States.

en: I stopped myself because I was about to sound like a brat. I was wishing my dad had given me a cool magic item to help on the quest, something as good as Luke’s flying shoes, or Annabeth’s invisible cap.
vi: Tôi im bặt, biết mình vừa suy nghĩ như đứa con hay vòi vĩnh. Tôi ước cha cho tôi một vật màu nhiệm có thể giúp tôi thực hiện nhiệm vụ này: một món đồ hữu dụng như giày biết bay của Luke hay mũ tàng hình của Annabeth.
tr: Daha fazla konuşmadım, tam bir velet gibi davranmak üzereydim. Babam bu görevimde yardımcı olsun diye havalıbir büyülü eşya verse keşke diye geçiyordu içimden. Şöyle Luke'un uçan ayakkabıları, Annabeth'in görünmezlik kepi gibi...
es: —Me detuve en seco, porque iba a sonar como un mocoso. Ojalá mi padre me hubiera dado un objeto mágico guay que me ayudara en la misión, algo tan bueno como las zapatillas voladoras de Luke o la gorra de invisibilidad de Annabeth.
vi_translation: I fell silent, knowing I had just thought like a child who often begs. I wished my father would give me a magical item that could help me accomplish this task: something useful like Luke's flying shoes or Annabeth's invisibility cap.
tr_translation: I didn't speak any further, I was about to act like a complete brat. I was wishing my dad would give me a cool magical item to help me with this task. Something like Luke's flying shoes or Annabeth's invisibility cap...
es_translation: —I stopped short, because I was about to sound like a brat. I wish my father had given me a cool magical object to help me on the mission, something as good as Luke's flying shoes or Annabeth's invisibility cap.

en: “The sword is celestial bronze. Forged by the Cyclopes, tempered in the heart of Mount Etna, cooled in the River Lethe. It’s deadly to monsters, to any creature from the Underworld, provided they don’t kill you first. But the blade will pass through mortals like an illusion. They simply are not important enough for the blade to kill. And I should warn you: as a demigod, you can be killed by either celestial or normal weapons. You are twice as vulnerable.”
vi: - Đây là kiếm thần. Sản phẩm từ chính tay người Cyclopes, được tôi trong lòng núi Etna rồi nhúng xuống sông Lethe. Với nó, cháu có thể giết được quái vật hay bất kỳ cơ thể sống nào dưới địa ngục, miễn là chúng chưa kịp ra tay trước. Nhưng lưỡi kiếm chỉ lướt qua cơ thể người phàm như ảo ảnh. Lý do đơn giản là người phàm quá chất phác nên thanh kiếm không giết. Ta nhắc cháu nhớ một điều: Vì là á thần nên cả vũ khí nhà trời lẫn phàm trần đều lấy mạng cháu được. Cho nên cháu phải cẩn thận gấp đôi.
tr: "Kılıç ilahi bronzdan yapılma. Kikloplar dövdü bu kılıcı, Etna Dağı'nın tam göbeğinde su verildi, Lethe Irmağı'nda soğutuldu. Canavarlara, Yeraltı Dünyası'nın tüm yaratıklarına karşı ölümcül; tabii, onlar seni daha önce öldürmezlerse. Ama ölümlülere değdi mi bir hayalet gibi geçer gider içlerinden. Kılıcın gücüne kıyasla ölümlülerin önemi yok. Seni uyarayım: bir yarı-tanrı olduğun için hem ilahi hem de normal silahlar sana işliyor. İki kat savunmasızsın.
es: —La espada está hecha de bronce celestial. Forjado por los cíclopes, templado en el corazón del monte Etna y enfriado en las aguas del río Lete. Es letal para los monstruos y para cualquier criatura del inframundo, siempre y cuando no te maten primero, claro. Sin embargo, a los mortales los atraviesa como una ilusión; sencillamente, no son lo bastante importantes para que la espada los mate. ¡Ah!, y he de advertirte otra cosa: como semidiós, puedes perecer tanto bajo armas celestiales como normales. Eres doblemente vulnerable.
vi_translation: - This is the divine sword. A product made by the hands of the Cyclopes, forged in the heart of Mount Etna and then quenched in the River Lethe. With it, you can kill monsters or any living being in the underworld, as long as they haven't struck first. But the blade will just pass through mortal bodies like an illusion. The simple reason is that mortals are too innocent for the sword to kill. I remind you of one thing: Because you are a demigod, both celestial and mortal weapons can take your life. So you must be doubly careful.
tr_translation: "The sword is made of divine bronze. The Cyclopes forged this sword, it was tempered in the heart of Mount Etna, cooled in the River Lethe. Deadly to monsters, to all creatures of the Underworld; of course, if they don't kill you first. But when it touches mortals, it passes through them like a ghost. Compared to the power of the sword, mortals are insignificant. Let me warn you: since you are a demigod, both divine and normal weapons affect you. You are twice as vulnerable."
es_translation: —The sword is made of celestial bronze. Forged by the Cyclopes, tempered in the heart of Mount Etna, and cooled in the waters of the River Lethe. It is lethal to monsters and any creature of the underworld, as long as they don't kill you first, of course. However, it passes through mortals like an illusion; they simply aren't important enough for the sword to kill them. Ah!, and I must warn you of one more thing: as a demigod, you can perish by both celestial and normal weapons. You are doubly vulnerable.

en: She thought about it. “Hard to say. But we can’t count on mortals for help. Maybe an emergency exit in the roof … ?”
vi: Annabeth trầm ngâm: - Khó nói lắm. Nhưng ta không nên trông cậy người phàm giúp đỡ. Biết đâu có lối thoát hiểm trên trần xe.
tr: Bunu biraz düşündü Annabeth. "Söylemesi zor. Ama yardım için ölümlülere güvenemeyiz. Belki çatıda bir acil durum çıkışı vardır?
es: Pensó en ello. —Es difícil saberlo. Pero no podemos contar con los mortales para que nos ayuden. ¿Y una salida de emergencia en el techo...?
vi_translation: Annabeth pondered: - It's hard to say. But we shouldn't rely on mortals for help. Who knows, there might be an escape hatch on the roof of the vehicle.
tr_translation: Annabeth thought about this for a moment. "It's hard to say. But we can't rely on mortals for help. Maybe there's an emergency exit on the roof?"
es_translation: He thought about it. —It is difficult to know. But we cannot count on the mortals to help us. What about an emergency exit on the roof...?

en: We careened out of the Lincoln Tunnel and back into the rainstorm, people and monsters tossed around the bus, cars plowed aside like bowling pins.
vi: Xe lao nhanh khỏi đường hầm, trở lại màn mưa tầm tã. Người và yêu quái bị quăng quật trong xe.
tr: Yan yatmış bir halde Lincoln Tüneli'nden çıktık ve tekrar yağmurlu fırtınaya daldık. Otobüste insanlar, canavarlar bir o yana, bir bu yana devriliyordu, çarptığımız arabalar bowling kukaları gibi sağa sola dağılıyordu.
es: Salimos del túnel Lincoln a toda velocidad y volvimos a la tormenta, hombres y monstruos dando tumbos dentro del autobús, mientras los coches eran apartados o derribados como si fueran bolos.
vi_translation: The car sped out of the tunnel, back into the torrential rain. Humans and monsters were tossed around inside the car.
tr_translation: We emerged from the Lincoln Tunnel lying down and plunged back into the rainy storm. On the bus, people and monsters were toppling this way and that, and the cars we hit were scattering like bowling pins.
es_translation: We exited the Lincoln Tunnel at full speed and returned to the storm, men and monsters tumbling inside the bus, while cars were pushed aside or knocked over like bowling pins.

en: Somehow the driver found an exit. We shot off the highway, through half a dozen traffic lights, and ended up barreling down one of those New Jersey rural roads where you can’t believe there’s so much nothing right across the river from New York. There were woods to our left, the Hudson River to our right, and the driver seemed to be veering toward the river.
vi: Xe hơi chạy dạt sang hai bên lề đường. Không hiểu bằng cách nào, bác tài tìm được đường thoát cho xe. Xe buýt lao vút trên xa lộ, vượt qua năm sáu ngã tư, cuối cùng lăn bánh trên đường đất vùng nông thôn New Jersey. Không ai tin ngay cạnh New York có loại đường vừa bé vừa lổn nhổn như vậy. Bên trái đường là rừng, bên phải là sông Hudson. Lúc này, hình như bác tài đang mất tay lái khiến xe gần lao xuống sông.
tr: Nasıl olduysa sürücü otobandan çıkışı buldu. Otobandan fırladık, yarım düzine trafik ışığı geçtik ve New Jersey'in kırsal bölgelerinden aşağı fıçı gibi yuvarlanmaya başladık. Ortalık o kadar ıssızdı ki, sanki New York'ta ırmağı geçtikten sonra hayat bitiyordu. Solumuzda korular, sağımızdaHudson Irmağı vardı ve sürücü ırmağı tercih etmiş gibiydi.
es: De algún modo, el conductor encontró una salida. Dejamos la autopista a todo trapo, cruzamos media docena de semáforos y acabamos, aún a velocidad de vértigo, en una de esas carreteras rurales de Nueva Jersey en las que es imposible creer que haya tanta nada justo al otro lado de Nueva York. Había un bosque a la izquierda y el río Hudson a la derecha, hacia donde el conductor parecía dirigirse.
vi_translation: The car swerved to the sides of the road. Somehow, the driver found a way to get the bus out. The bus sped along the highway, passed through five or six intersections, and finally rolled onto a dirt road in rural New Jersey. No one could believe that right next to New York there could be such small and bumpy roads. On the left side of the road is a forest, and on the right is the Hudson River. At this moment, it seems the driver is losing control of the steering wheel, causing the car to nearly plunge into the river.
tr_translation: Somehow, the driver found the exit off the highway. We shot off the highway, passed half a dozen traffic lights, and started rolling down like a barrel through the rural areas of New Jersey. The area was so desolate that it felt as if life ended after crossing the river in New York. There were groves to our left, the Hudson River to our right, and it seemed the driver preferred the river.
es_translation: Somehow, the driver found an exit. We left the highway at full speed, crossed half a dozen traffic lights, and ended up, still at breakneck speed, on one of those rural roads in New Jersey where it's impossible to believe there's so much nothingness just on the other side of New York. There was a forest to the left and the Hudson River to the right, towards which the driver seemed to be heading.

en: Her accent sounded vaguely Middle Eastern, too. She said, “Children, it is too late to be out all alone. Where are your parents?”
vi: Giọng nói bà chủ mang chút âm hưởng của người Trung Đông. - Trời khuya thế này, sao các cháu còn tự ý ra ngoài? Cha mẹ các cháu đâu?
tr: Aksanında da belli belirsiz bir Orta Doğululuk vardı. "Çocuklar, dışarıda tek başına dolaşılmayacak kadar geç oldu," dedi. "Anne babanız nerede?
es: Su acento sonaba ligeramente a Oriente Medio. —Niños, es muy tarde para estar solos fuera —dijo—. ¿Dónde están vuestros padres?
vi_translation: The hostess's voice carried a hint of a Middle Eastern accent. - It's so late at night, why are you kids out on your own? Where are your parents?
tr_translation: There was a faint hint of a Middle Eastern accent in his voice. "Children, it's too late to be wandering outside alone," he said. "Where are your parents?"
es_translation: His accent sounded slightly Middle Eastern. —Children, it's very late to be outside alone —he said—. Where are your parents?

en: “We got separated from our caravan,” I said. “Our circus caravan. The ringmaster told us to meet him at the gas station if we got lost, but he may have forgotten, or maybe he meant a different gas station. Anyway, we’re lost. Is that food I smell?”
vi: - Tụi cháu tách ra khỏi đoàn. Chúng cháu làm cho gánh xiếc mà. Ông chú dặn nếu đi lạc, cứ đến cây xăng này, ông sẽ đợi. Nhưng chắc ông ấy quên, hoặc dặn trạm xăng khác nhưng cháu hiều lầm. Dù ông ấy có nói gì thì giờ chúng cháu bị lạc rồi. Có phải mùi thức ăn không ạ?
tr: "Karavanımızdan ayrıldık," dedim. "Sirk karavanımız. Sirk amiri, kaybolursak onu benzin istasyonunda beklememizi söylemişti ama ya unuttu ya başka benzin istasyonunu kastetmiş. Neyse, kaybolduk. Burnuma gelen yemek kokusu mu?
es: —Nos separamos de la caravana —contesté—. Nuestra caravana del circo. El director de pista nos dijo que nos encontraríamos en la gasolinera si nos perdíamos, pero puede que se haya olvidado, o a lo mejor se refería a otra gasolinera.
